content.title: Crescendo TIA
content.definition: Repetitive transient ischemic attacks occurring with increasing frequency over a short time period, indicating an unstable carotid plaque and high imminent stroke risk.

clinical_features.frequency: Two or more TIAs within 24 hours, or increasing frequency
clinical_features.pattern: Stereotyped symptoms suggesting same vascular territory
clinical_features.instability: Indicates active plaque with ongoing embolization

clinical_features.recurrent_embolization: Repeated showers of emboli from unstable lesion
clinical_features.thrombus_propagation: Progressive luminal narrowing from thrombus growth

clinical_features.anticoagulation: Heparin considered by some for plaque stabilization
clinical_features.urgent_imaging: Immediate carotid imaging to identify culprit lesion
clinical_features.urgent_revascularization: CEA within 24-48 hours if significant stenosis identified

clinical_features.delay_risks: Each day delay increases stroke risk
clinical_features.exceptions: May delay if large infarct on imaging
clinical_features.outcomes: Early surgery safe and effective in most cases

clinical_features.stroke_risk: Up to 20% stroke risk within 7 days if untreated
clinical_features.surgical_benefit: NNT of 5-6 for CEA in symptomatic stenosis

content.statement: Crescendo TIA is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Cerebrovascular that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
